abstract: Banks had the biggest drop in the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index amid concern about their ability to increase profits.
snippet: Banks had the biggest drop in the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index amid concern about their ability to increase profits.
lead_paragraph: Stocks fell, reversing a rally that sent the Dow Jones industrial average toward its highest level since 2008 earlier Thursday, after bank shares tumbled and a report showed that sales of new homes declined unexpectedly.

headline.main: Markets Fall as Bank Shares and Home Sales Decline
headline.print_headline: Markets Fall as Bank Shares and Home Sales Decline
